result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Eric C Biekkola was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AODA Assessment and Drivers Safety Plan.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on a highway in this State unless authorized by the MVD.
Defendant shall not operate a vehicle anywhere with any amount of alcohol in his system.
Defendant shall not operate a vehicle anywhere with any detectable amount of restricted controlled substances in blood.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.

Defendant shall receive Alcohol and other Drug Assessment from Waupaca County DHHS or other licensed agency as determined by Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations including establishment of a driver safety plan.

timeConds.notes:
Defendant granted good time credit.
Defendant may serve in Outagamie County if arrangements can be made.
**Amended 4/22/19 to reflect defendant to serve 90 days conditional jail time.

records.addlTxt:
D.A. John Snider appeared for the state.
Defendant appeared in person with Atty. Peterson.
Plea quest. and waiver of rights form filed today.
Victim impact statement provided to the Court.
The defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1.  Plea accepted by the Court after rights were explained, and defendant found guilty as to Count 1.
Count 2 is dismissed.
Count 3 is dismissed and read in.
The Court orders that sentence be withheld and places the defendant on probation for a period of 3 years. 
Conditions:  Pay a fine of $1000.00 plus costs (total is $$2315.50), pay all costs and supervision fees, pay restitution per the summary, undergo AODA and any other assessments and counseling deemed appropriate by the agent and abide by all treatment recommendations, comply with driver's safety plan, not operate a motor vehicle in this state without a valid driver's license, or with any amount of alcohol or restricted controlled substances in blood, revocation of operating privileges for a period of 36 months,  IID for 36 months.  Defendant to serve 9 months in jail, with good time and huber privileges, to commence forthwith. Defendant to report immediately and may serve the sentence in Outagamie County. 
Appeal rights, voting and firearms restrictions were provided.
